intro: Cachrys meliocarpoides var. arcis-romanae, commonly known as the Roman arcis-cachrys, is a rare and lesser-known plant species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of other members of its family. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It is native to specific regions in southern Europe, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanical curiosity and of interest to botanists and conservationists.
